00010 ORVTreeWriter::ORVTreeWriter(ORVDataDecoder* decoder, string treeName) :
00011 ORDataProcessor(decoder)
00012 {
00013   fTreeName = treeName;
00014   if(fTreeName == "") fTreeName = "ORTree";
00015   fTree = NULL;
00016   fThisProcessorAutoFillsTree = true;
00017   fUniqueTree = false;
00018   fFillPeriod = 1;
00019   fFillMethod = kFillAfterProcessDataRecord;
00020   fFillCount = 0;
00021   fLastProcessedRecordRetCode = kSuccess;
00022   fSaveOnlyNonemptyTrees = false;  // I would prefer 'true', but this (false) will keep the ancient behaviour -tb- 2008-07-25
00023 }
00024 
00025 ORDataProcessor::EReturnCode ORVTreeWriter::StartRun()
00026 {
00027   EReturnCode retCode = InitializeTree();
00028   if (retCode >= kAlarm) return retCode;
00029 
00030   fFillCount = 0;
00031   if(fFillPeriod < 1) {
00032     ORLog(kWarning) << "StartRun(): This processor is supposed "
00033                     << "to fill the tree, but the fill period has been "
00034                     << "set to be < 1 (=" << fFillPeriod << "); " 
00035                     << "will set to 1" << endl;
00036     fFillPeriod = 1;
00037   }
00038   return kSuccess;
00039 }
00040 
00041 ORDataProcessor::EReturnCode ORVTreeWriter::ProcessDataRecord(UInt_t* record)
00042 {
00043   if (!fDoProcess || !fDoProcessRun || !fRunContext) return kFailure;
00044   if (fDataDecoder->DataIdOf(record) != fDataId) return kSuccess;
00045   if(fRunContext->MustSwap() && !fRunContext->IsRecordSwapped()) {
00046     /* Swapping the record.  This only must be done once! */
00047     fDataDecoder->Swap(record);
00048     fRunContext->SetRecordSwapped();
00049   }
00050 
00051   if (fThisProcessorAutoFillsTree && 
00052       fFillMethod == kFillBeforeProcessDataRecord &&
00053       fLastProcessedRecordRetCode == kSuccess) {
00054     if (fFillCount > 0 && fFillCount % fFillPeriod == 0) fTree->Fill();
00055     fFillCount++;
00056   }
00057 
00058   if(fDebugRecord) fDataDecoder->DumpHex(record);
00059 
00060   fLastProcessedRecordRetCode = ProcessMyDataRecord(record);
00061   if (fLastProcessedRecordRetCode >= kAlarm) return fLastProcessedRecordRetCode;
00062 
00063   if (fThisProcessorAutoFillsTree && 
00064       fFillMethod == kFillAfterProcessDataRecord &&
00065       fLastProcessedRecordRetCode == kSuccess) {
00066     fFillCount++;
00067     if (fFillCount % fFillPeriod == 0) fTree->Fill();
00068   }
00069   return fLastProcessedRecordRetCode;
00070 }
00071    // -tb- 2008-02-19
00080 ORDataProcessor::EReturnCode ORVTreeWriter::EndRun()
00081 {
00082   // Write the tree only if this processor is meant to write it.
00083   // fUniqueTree implies that the tree was manually filled; it still should
00084   // be written automatically. A manual write can be performed by
00085   // overloading this function.
00086   if (fThisProcessorAutoFillsTree || fUniqueTree) {
00087     if (fFillMethod == kFillBeforeProcessDataRecord && fLastProcessedRecordRetCode == kSuccess) fTree->Fill();
00088 
00089     if (fTree->GetEntries() == 0) {
00090       ORLog(kWarning) << "EndRun(): no entries in fTree " << fTree->GetName() << endl;
00091     }
00092 
00093     if (fThisProcessorAutoFillsTree) {
00094       if (fTree->GetEntries() != fFillCount/fFillPeriod) {
00095         ORLog(kWarning) << fFillCount << ' ' << fFillPeriod << endl;
00096         ORLog(kWarning) << "EndRun(): expected tree to have "
00097                         << fFillCount/fFillPeriod << " entries, but found "
00098                         << fTree->GetEntries() << ": did more than one "
00099                         << "processor try to fill this tree? " << endl;
00100       }
00101     }
00102 
00103     // -tb- original code: fTree->Write(fTree->GetName(), TObject::kOverwrite);
00104     if(fSaveOnlyNonemptyTrees){// -tb- 2008-02-19 - moved to base class ORVTreeWriter 2008-07-25
00105       if (fTree->GetEntries() != 0) fTree->Write(fTree->GetName(), TObject::kOverwrite);
00106       else ORLog(kWarning) << "EndRun(): did not write empty fTree " << fTree->GetName() << endl;
00107 
00108     }else{
00109        fTree->Write(fTree->GetName(), TObject::kOverwrite);
00110     }
00111   }
00112   return kSuccess;
00113 }
00114 
00115 ORDataProcessor::EReturnCode ORVTreeWriter::InitializeTree()
00116 {
00117   // check if the tree alread exists -- this way, several processors can
00118   // write to the same tree. 
00119   fTree = (TTree*) gDirectory->FindObject(fTreeName.c_str()); 
00120 
00121   // If the tree is supposed to be unique, keep looking until you get a
00122   // tree with a unique name. fTree is left NULL so that a new one will be
00123   // made in the next code block.
00124   if(fUniqueTree) {
00125     int i=2;
00126     string treeNameBase = fTreeName;
00127     while(fTree != NULL) {
00128       SetTreeName(treeNameBase + Form("_%d", i++));
00129       fTree = (TTree*) gDirectory->FindObject(fTreeName.c_str()); 
00130     }
00131   }
00132 
00133   // If fTree is still NULL by this point, need to make a new one.
00134   if(fTree == NULL) {
00135     if(gROOT->GetListOfFiles()->GetSize() == 0) {
00136       ORLog(kWarning) << "InitializeTree(): no root file open. " 
00137                       << "Building tree " << fTreeName
00138                       << " in gDirectory = gROOT, will not be saved..." 
00139                       << endl;
00140     }
00141 
00142     // fTree is owned by parent root file (or gROOT); 
00143     // it will be deleted upon fFile->Close() (or end of program).
00144     // So there is no delete associated with this call to new.
00145     fTree = new TTree(fTreeName.c_str(), fTreeName.c_str()); 
00146 
00147     // always save the run number
00148     if (!fRunContext) {
00149       ORLog(kError) << "fRunContext is NULL!" << endl;
00150       return kFailure;
00151     }
00152     fTree->Branch("runNumber", fRunContext->GetPointerToRunNumber(), "runNumber/I");
00153   }
00154 
00155   return InitializeBranches();
00156 }
00157 
00158 void ORVTreeWriter::SetThisProcessorAutoFillsTree(bool fillTree)
00159 {
00160   if(fillTree && fUniqueTree) {
00161     // fUniqueTree == true means that SetDoNotAutoFillTree was called, so
00162     // this function shouldn't be called!
00163     ORLog(kWarning) << "SetThisProcessorAutoFillsTree(true): This processor "
00164                     << "does not autofill, ignoring." << endl;
00165     return;
00166   }
00167   fThisProcessorAutoFillsTree = fillTree;
00168 }
00169 
00170 void ORVTreeWriter::SetDoNotAutoFillTree()
00171 {
00172   if(fTree != NULL) {
00173     ORLog(kWarning) << "SetDoNotAutoFillTree(): this function should be"
00174                     << "called in the constructor of a derived class that "
00175                     << "fills its tree manually. You seem to have called "
00176                     << "it after the tree has been made! That is a bad idea." 
00177                     << endl;
00178   }
00179   if(fUniqueTree == true) {
00180     ORLog(kWarning) << "SetDoNotAutoFillTree(): fUniqueTree was already true. "
00181                     << "Did you try to call this function twice?" << endl;
00182   }
00183   SetThisProcessorAutoFillsTree(false); // never call fTree->Fill() within ORVTreeWriter.cc
00184   fUniqueTree = true; 
00185 }
